clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Mental Health Physician Support Program in Nova Scotia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Mental Health Physician Support Program in Nova Scotia: Impact on Patient Outcomes and Stigmatization

brief_summary.textblock:
The Department of Health and Wellness (DHW), along with key stakeholders, are ready to launch a demonstration project for another deliverable of the province's mental health and addictions strategy, "Together We Can". The demonstration project is for the Adult Mental Health Module of the Practice Support Program (PSP), a training program for family physicians developed by family physicians.
The investigators will be completing a randomized control trial to determine the program/tools effectiveness, its power to reduce stigma and its ability to increase the comfort level of physicians in providing treatment to those living with mental illness in a primary care setting.
110 Nova Scotia family physicians along with their medical office assistants administrative assistants/secretaries will participate to evaluate this program before deciding on whether or not it will be implemented on a more permanent basis in Nova Scotia.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

primary_outcome.measure: â€¢ Change from Baseline to study end-point of the Patient Health Questionnaire-9(PHQ-9)score in patients
primary_outcome.description: The PHQ-9, developed by Drs. Robert L. Spitzer, Janet B.W. Williams specifically for primary care settings is a self-report instrument which takes only a few minutes to complete. The tool is highly sensitive and specific for the diagnosis of depression, and covers the nine symptom-based DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual) and DSM-5 criteria for major depression. It can also produce dimensional symptom severity ratings. The scale covers a two week time frame, essentially covering current rather than past episodes. The PHQ-9 has been extensively validated and is widely used in primary care as a screening instrument and for monitoring treatment outcomes. A PHQ-9 score >10 has a sensitivity for major depression of 88%, and a specificity of 88%, and a positive likelihood ratio of 7.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lam's Employment Absence and Productivity Scale (LEAPS)
secondary_outcome.description: As a measure of occupational functioning, Lam's Employment Absence and Productivity Scale (LEAPS) will be used . This scale was developed in Canada to assess the workplace impact of major depression. LEAPS displayed excellent internal consistency as assessed by Cronbach's alpha: 0.89. During scale development, validity was assessed by comparing the LEAPS to the other clinical and work functioning scales, where it showed excellent concordant validity.

other_outcome.description: For the purposes of quantifying economic impacts, the Client Service Receipt Inventory will be used . This is a well-used and extensively validated inventory.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adult Mental Health Training practice support program

intervention.intervention_name: Primary Care Mental Health Training and Support Program
intervention.description: The principal components of the program include: (1) training and (2) practice support. Training is delivered in three half day workshop-style sessions conducted over a 24 week period. Practice support is two-fold Through 3 tools which provide an Assessment tool and 3 different evidence based Supported Self Management tools : 1. The Cognitive Behavioral Interpersonal Skills Manual 2. The Bounceback program led by the Canadian Mental Health Association, British Columbia Division, which consists of a telephone delivered evidence-based skills program designed to help adults experiencing symptoms of mild to moderate depression 3. The Antidepressant Skills Workbook for patients with mild and moderate depression. Through a practice support coordinator to ensure participants receive as much benefit as possible throughout the training period and have the guidance they need to incorporate newly acquired tools, skills, and processes into their every-day practice workflow

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:To be eligible, patients must
have been identified as depressed by a physician-participant in the trial and must have a PHQ-9 score of > 10 at the time of enrollment.
be over the age of 18
be able to read and speak in English
have sufficiently intact cognitive functioning, according to the judgment of the physician
be free of urgent or emergent medical or psychiatric issues such as unstable cardiovascular disease or suicidal ideation potentially requiring hospitalization.
-
Exclusion Criteria:
not currently under treatment for depression either with an antidepressant medication or psychotherapy.
